results.title: Jailhouse shock
results.creator_credit: Ivor Dunkerton and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
In New Jersey State Prison, a group of hardened inmates conduct a program in which young offenders on probation are confronted with the horrors of prison life - homosexual rape, murder, suicide, etc. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Gale is dead [B&W]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Gale was 19, beautiful, intelligent, had much to offer and everything to live for. However she was a drug addict, and was recently found dead. She had been shifted in and out of 14 institutions throughout her life and believed no-one cared for her. Reporter Harold Williamson talks to people in Gale’s life and the film asks if Gale need have died, and tries to show that there may be other Gales for whom it is not too late to help. Letters read by Anna Frankel.

results.title: Could do better
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
In this film Jim Douglas Henry looks at those children who suffer from dyslexia, and asks several questions: Is enough being done for dyslexic children? Why do some experts argue that dyslexia is nothing but a label used to excuse backward children?

results.title: A Case of suicide
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Katie, aged 17, commits suicide when her husband deserts her. The discussion with the intimates attempts to recognise the signs preceding the serious attempt at suicide and what can be done to avoid it happening.

results.title: All our tomorrows
results.creator_credit: Rosalind Eduemon, Rosalind Farber and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
This film examines an integrated community care program in Canada which allows older people to remain in the community as long as possible and lead full, happy and productive lives.

results.title: The Act of abortion
results.creator_credit: Terence O'Reilly, Shirley Fisher and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
An examination of the difficulties which surround women who want and those who perform the act of abortion. The 1967 Abortion Act in Britain is to be reviewed. This well intentioned legislation has resulted in illogicalities whereby some private abortionists are profitting while the National Health Service is sometimes reluctant to help.
